## Data Structures

### Vector

```{r}
v1 <- c("a", "b", "c", "d", "e", 
        "f", "g", "h", "i", "j")
```

```{r}
print(v1)
```

```{r}
v2 <- c(1:10)
```

```{r}
v3 <- c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE)
```

```{r}
class(v1)
class(v2)
class(v3)
```

```{r}
v4 <- c(-1.5,2.3, 4.7)
class(v4)
```

```{r}
class(v1)
```


#### Naming a vector elements
```{r}
setNames(v2, v1)
```

#### Length of a vector
```{r}
length(v1)
```


#### Subsetting a vector

```{r}
print(v1[3])
```

```{r}
print(v1[c(1,3)])
```

```{r}
print(letters)
```

```{r}
print(letters)
```

```{r}
print(letters[c(1:10)])
```

can use negative sign to exclude
```{r}
print(letters[-c(1:10)])
```

### Factor

```{r}
attributes(v1)
```

```{r}
attributes(setNames(v2,v1))
```


#### Creating a factor

```{r}
f1 <- factor(v2)
```

```{r}
print(f1)
```

```{r}
attributes(f1)
```

```{r}
v4 <- c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 4, 3, 4, 3, 3)
```

```{r}
length(v4)
```

```{r}

table(f2)
```
